name: Nana's Fastnachts
author: Sandy
summary: These are similar to doughnuts but much tastier! They are usually made on Shrove Tuesday (Fat Tuesday).
ingredients: ¼ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: Warm the milk in a small saucepan until it bubbles, then remove from heat
In a small bowl, proof the yeast by adding the warm water to the yeast
In a large bowl mix together the teaspoon of sugar and 3 cups of the flour
Add proofed yeast and mix well
Cover and let rise until doubled in size
Stir in beaten eggs, melted butter or margarine, one cup of sugar, salt, and enough of the remaining flour to make a stiff dough
Cover and let rise for a second time until doubled
Punch down dough and divide into 2 portions
On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough to 1/2 inch thickness
Cut dough with a biscuit cutter
Make 2 slits with a sharp knife in the middle of each doughnut
Cover and let rise a third time until doubled in size
Deep fat fry in oil or lard for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until lightly browned
Toss in confectioners sugar while still warm
